content:
• Monday, October 3, 2011
  • TISI

    Team's (NASDAQ:TISI) FQ1 beat top-line estimates on a 35% Y/Y jump in the firm's maintenance and...

    Team's (NASDAQ:TISI) FQ1 beat top-line estimates on a 35% Y/Y jump in the firm's maintenance and construction revenue. A recent acquisition, Quest Integrity, contributed $7.4M to the quarter's revenue total and organic revenue grew at a solid 28% clip. Shares +3.3% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:42 PM
  • SOMX

    Somaxon Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:SOMX) jumps in post-trade after saying it had a productive...

    Somaxon Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:SOMX) jumps in post-trade after saying it had a productive meeting with the FDA relating to the over-the-counter development program for its insomnia drug Silenor, developed jointly with Procter & Gamble (NYSE:PG). SOMX +22.5% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:50 PM
  • MOS

    Well played, Cargill. Mosaic (MOS -3.8%) continues a slide begun right around the time the...

    Well played, Cargill. Mosaic (MOS -3.8%) continues a slide begun right around the time the secretive commodity giant announced it was unloading its stake in the potash company. Hitting a 52-week low today, Mosaic shares are off more than 40% since Cargill's move last January.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:44 PM
  • AAL

    In response to today's 33.1% decline, AMR's PR head says "there is no company-driven news"...

    In response to today's 33.1% decline, AMR's PR head says "there is no company-driven news" behind the drop, and a bankruptcy filing is "not our goal or preference." But he adds, "we know we need to improve our results." (previously)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:37 PM
  • C

    New multi-year lows all around amongst the large banks: C -9.8%, BAC -9.6%, and MS -7.7% were...

    New multi-year lows all around amongst the large banks: C -9.8%, BAC -9.6%, and MS -7.7% were hardest hit. GS -4.7%, WFC -3.9%, and  JPM -4.9% also taking lumps. Friday's news that the CA AG is pulling out of fraudclosure settlement talks and today's word the FHA may deny lenders payments due show how politically toxic the banks have become.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:27 PM | 1 Comment
  • SPWR

    Solar stocks had an especially bad day, fueled in part by SunPower's (SPWRA -11.7%) announcement...

    Solar stocks had an especially bad day, fueled in part by SunPower's (SPWRA -11.7%) announcement it will lower it 2011 guidance during its Nov. 3 earnings call. JASO -14.6%. HSOL -22%. STP -13.9%. FSLR -8.4%. LDK -13.3%. CSIQ -13.5%. TSL -8.6%. YGE -7.1%.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:11 PM | 7 Comments
  • UPL

    Ultra Petroleum (UPL -7.3%) closes near its lows for the day after BMC initiates the shares with...

    Ultra Petroleum (UPL -7.3%) closes near its lows for the day after BMC initiates the shares with a tepid hold rating, saying the lack of near-term positive catalysts doesn't provide an attractive growth story compared to several other Marcellus names in its coverage group.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:08 PM | 1 Comment
  • IDA

    Power supplier Idacorp (IDA +0.3%) clings to positive territory after KeyBanc ups the shares to...

    Power supplier Idacorp (IDA +0.3%) clings to positive territory after KeyBanc ups the shares to buy, citing recent tax accounting changes and the settlement of its Idaho rate case.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:47 PM
  • SSKN

    Relief for long-suffering investors in Mela Sciences (MELA +4.1%) may soon be at hand, Barron's...

    Relief for long-suffering investors in Mela Sciences (MELA +4.1%) may soon be at hand, Barron's writes. The maker of a promising device for diagnosis cancer said last week that the FDA had finally issued an "approvals letter," which analysts say should help it resolve all remaining issues before a final vote.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:44 PM
  • VHC

    VirnetX (VHC -16.8%) crashes after the USPTO grants requests from Apple (NASDAQ:AAPL) and Cisco...

    VirnetX (VHC -16.8%) crashes after the USPTO grants requests from Apple (NASDAQ:AAPL) and Cisco (NASDAQ:CSCO), both of whom VirnetX is suing, to reexamine one of its patents.  VirnetX says it welcome the USPTO's move, though this simply appears to be an attempt to save face. (patent filing)

     
     
     
     
    | 3:44 PM | 10 Comments
  • ZLC

    Shares of Zale (ZLC -18.6%) took a pounding today after last week's selloff in high-end jewelry...

    Shares of Zale (ZLC -18.6%) took a pounding today after last week's selloff in high-end jewelry companies filtered down to hit the retail and kiosk sub-sector with the same negative sentiment.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:42 PM
  • VRML

    It's been a wild ride today for pharmaceutical developer Vermillion (NASDAQ:VRML), jumping +19%...

    It's been a wild ride today for pharmaceutical developer Vermillion (NASDAQ:VRML), jumping +19% at the open on positive preliminary results for its PAD drug Vasclir, only to reverse course and tumble -13% as the biotech sector continues to collapse. Other biotech shares getting hit today: Cerus (CERS -5.2%), EXACT Sciences (EXAS -5.2%), Quest Diagnostics (DGX -5.2%), Gen-Probe (GPRO -3.8%), and (CPHD -2.6%).

     
     
     
     
    | 3:30 PM
  • CCL

    Carnival Cruise Lines (CCL -2.1%) announces it will invest $500M to transform its on-board...

    Carnival Cruise Lines (CCL -2.1%) announces it will invest $500M to transform its on-board customer experience with new entertainment and dining options in an effort to reinvigorate bookings. Both CCL and rival Royal Caribbean Cruises (RCL -7.1%) battle a harsh outlook for the industry tainted by "middle-class malaise."

     
     
     
     
    | 3:29 PM
  • AAL

    AMR is now down 34.8% on bankruptcy fears, but bond analyst Roger King doesn't expect to see...

    AMR is now down 34.8% on bankruptcy fears, but bond analyst Roger King doesn't expect to see such an event, given AMR's main reasons for filing - cutting debt, reducing payroll, or preparing for a merger - would all be unlikely to happen. In addition, King thinks AMR has enough cash to handle short-term losses.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:21 PM
  • ACUR

    Whether it's a continued delayed reaction to a patent victory last week or a good ole case of...

    Whether it's a continued delayed reaction to a patent victory last week or a good ole case of momentum investing, shares of Acura Pharmaceuticals (OTC:ACUR +13.2%) are closing in on knocking out their 2nd consecutive double-digit gain on heavy trading volume.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:20 PM
  • KIOR

    Biofuel producer KiOR (KIOR -8.3%) trades lower after Baird downgrades the shares to...

    Biofuel producer KiOR (KIOR -8.3%) trades lower after Baird downgrades the shares to underperform on valuation. The stock has been on a tear recently, having gained +80% since late August.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:52 PM
  • CX

    Shares in Cemex (NYSE:CX) are halted in Mexico after the cement maker plunges almost 15%. The...

    Shares in Cemex (NYSE:CX) are halted in Mexico after the cement maker plunges almost 15%. The company continues to struggle under the debt load taken on when acquiring Australia's Rinker at the top of the market in 2007. The ADRs continue to trade in NYC, -17.4%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:37 PM
  • CAST

    Chinacast Education (OTCPK:CAST -21.4%), a provider of college courses and online learning...

    Chinacast Education (OTCPK:CAST -21.4%), a provider of college courses and online learning services, tumbles after its CEO issues a letter (.pdf) claiming Chinacast's decision to expand its board was motivated by "certain recent issues and conduct," and that its Audit Committee will be conducting an independent review of Chinacast's cash balances.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:31 PM
  • MNTA

    Momenta Pharmaceuticals (MNTA +0.4%) holds on to gains in a weak tape after the company says...

    Momenta Pharmaceuticals (MNTA +0.4%) holds on to gains in a weak tape after the company says it's seeking a temporary restraining order in its ongoing pursuit to prevent Watson Pharmaceuticals (WPI -4.9%) and its partners from launching a blood thinner product in the U.S.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:30 PM
  • MU

    Crushed on Friday following a poor FQ4 report (I, II), Micron (MU -10.5%) is selling off again...

    Crushed on Friday following a poor FQ4 report (I, II), Micron (MU -10.5%) is selling off again today. A Lazard report claiming Rambus (RMBS +0.2%) could win its antitrust suit against Micron and Hynix could be having an effect, but judging by the minimal move in Rambus shares, post-earnings pessimism is likely still playing a role.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:16 PM
  • TENX

    Oxygen Biotherapeutics (OXBT -4.31%) trades down after announcing on Friday that its interim...

    Oxygen Biotherapeutics (OXBT -4.31%) trades down after announcing on Friday that its interim director Rene Eckert and director J. Melville Engle have both resigned, as the shakeup continues at the struggling biotech company.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:05 PM
  • MS

    As Morgan Stanley (MS -6.2%) continues to dive on fears its Euro exposure will make it the next...

    As Morgan Stanley (MS -6.2%) continues to dive on fears its Euro exposure will make it the next Lehman, analysts continue rushing to its defense. In addition to Wells Fargo, Credit Suisse is out with a report claiming Morgan Stanley, whose Tier 1 capital ratio is more than twice its Q1 '09 level, can absorb any euro-related losses.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:03 PM | 1 Comment
  • BAC

    The first business day of Q4 sees some of the same old problems for Bank of America (NYSE:BAC)...

    The first business day of Q4 sees some of the same old problems for Bank of America (NYSE:BAC) with shares down 7% and its website inexplicably suffering outages again (previous) - handcuffing online banking customers. Latest damage control from BofA: "It’s not malware, it’s not hacking, there is no compromise to customer information. I know there’s people out there saying that. It’s not true."

     
     
     
     
    | 1:49 PM | 1 Comment
  • S

    Macquarie's Kevin Smithen is cutting his PTs on wireless carriers Sprint (S -5%), Leap Wireless...

    Macquarie's Kevin Smithen is cutting his PTs on wireless carriers Sprint (S -5%), Leap Wireless (LEAP -10.3%), and MetroPCS (PCS -6.2%), as well as rural wireline carrier Frontier (FTR -6.7%), on a belief that the recent breakdown in the high-yield debt market will both produce higher borrowing costs and hurt equity values.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:46 PM
  • BEN

    Franklin Resources (BEN -3.7%) is lower today after JPMorgan cut the shares to underweight,...

    Franklin Resources (BEN -3.7%) is lower today after JPMorgan cut the shares to underweight, saying fund performance and returns have shown signs of material weakening. Franklin's flagship fund takes significant currency risk, the firm notes, causing it to significantly underperform its global fixed income fund peers.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:40 PM
  • C

    Stocks carve out new lows on the session, the S&P 500 -1.5%, Nasdaq -1.8%. Financials are...

    Stocks carve out new lows on the session, the S&P 500 -1.5%, Nasdaq -1.8%. Financials are leading the way down. C -6.3%, BAC -6.1%, GS -3.1%. Morgan Stanley (MS -6%) dives after a 4% pop on the open following Jim Cramer's passionate defense of the firm.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:12 PM | 2 Comments
  • AAL

    AMR halts trading after it tanks -29.7% to its lowest level in over two years on renewed...

    AMR halts trading after it tanks -29.7% to its lowest level in over two years on renewed concerns the troubled airline is about to file for bankruptcy. Fueling the speculation are concerns that the company has burned through its reserves, and reports that more than 200 pilots have retired from its central hub in Fort Worth, Texas over the last two months, compared with a typical monthly dozen.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:07 PM | 2 Comments
  • RGC

    Regal Entertainment (RGC +3.5%) catches an upgrade from MKM Partners to a Buy rating from...

    Regal Entertainment (RGC +3.5%) catches an upgrade from MKM Partners to a Buy rating from Neutral on valuation. Sony's (NYSE:SNE) decision to charge theater operators for 3D glasses isn't whacking shares of RGC quite as harshly as RealD (NYSE:RLD) - down 17% over 5 trading sessions. Nonetheless, the firm looks set to contest the action - saying it "would be forced to evaluate this new economic model and program our screens accordingly."

     
     
     
     
    | 12:45 PM
  • ARCH

    Coal stocks are suffering after Arch Coal (ACI -7%) slashed its FY outlook on Friday for the...

    Coal stocks are suffering after Arch Coal (ACI -7%) slashed its FY outlook on Friday for the second time this year: Patriot Coal (PCX -7%), Consolidated Energy (CNX -4.8%), Alpha Natural Resources (ANR -4.2%) and Peabody Energy (BTU -2.8%).
     
     
     
     
    | 12:45 PM | 1 Comment
  • BAC

    Bank of America (BAC -2.7%) sinks below $6, hitting its lowest price since March 2009. The...

    Bank of America (BAC -2.7%) sinks below $6, hitting its lowest price since March 2009. The shares are about 15% lower than the level they were at when Buffett announced his investment in the bank. Like the Goldman and GE deals, the move may pay off for Buffett; for shareholders, not so much.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:36 PM | 7 Comments
  • SVRA

    Microcap bioresearch firm Adventrx Pharmaceuticals (ANX -1.1%) is lower today after the FDA says...

    Microcap bioresearch firm Adventrx Pharmaceuticals (ANX -1.1%) is lower today after the FDA says the company will need to repeat a study of its lung-cancer treatment Exelbine because it can't verify the authenticity of certain drugs in the previous trial. The shares have been pummeled this year, down nearly 78% since mid-July.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:26 PM

  • Shares of American Airlines are now off 16% after this morning's downgrade on sector peers...

    Shares of American Airlines are now off 16% after this morning's downgrade on sector peers kickstarts renewed banter about the carrier filing for bankruptcy. The stock now sits just a hair above its 52-week low.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:23 PM
  • AEIS

    Advanced Energy (AEIS -7.5%) takes a hit after Needham cuts the shares to hold, citing general...

    Advanced Energy (AEIS -7.5%) takes a hit after Needham cuts the shares to hold, citing general weakness in its solar and film businesses.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:14 PM
  • AMED

    An inquiry by the Senate Finance Committee finds the nation's three largest home-health...

    An inquiry by the Senate Finance Committee finds the nation's three largest home-health companies tailored the care they provided to Medicare patients to maximize reimbursements. The three companies, Amedisys (AMED -4.8%), LHC (LHCG -5.3%) and Gentiva (GTIV -14%), rely on Medicare for most of their revenues.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:09 PM | 1 Comment
  • VIAB

    Goldman Sachs removes Viacom (VIA.B -1.8%) from its Conviction Buy list, as well as slashing its...

    Goldman Sachs removes Viacom (VIA.B -1.8%) from its Conviction Buy list, as well as slashing its estimates for both FY12 and FY13 EPS by close to 1%. On the positive side, analysts kept the company rated a Buy and the new $49 price target still represents 29% upside potential for shares.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:08 PM
  • LEU

    Uranium supplier USEC (USU) is down 18% today, bringing its losses over the last two trading...

    Uranium supplier USEC (USU) is down 18% today, bringing its losses over the last two trading days to 26%. USEC began its descent after announcing on Friday it would be cutting its spending rate for a new uranium centrifuge plant, as it continues awaiting a DOE loan guarantee for the project.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:56 AM
  • TEVA

    NuPathe (PATH +12.38%) pops after saying it found a low incidence of adverse events in a...

    NuPathe (PATH +12.38%) pops after saying it found a low incidence of adverse events in a 12-month, repeat-use trial of its Zelrix migraine patch, the company's key product.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:50 AM
  • RBCN

    Rubicon Technology (RBCN -8.2%) trades down after Canaccord cuts its price target to $9 from...

    Rubicon Technology (RBCN -8.2%) trades down after Canaccord cuts its price target to $9 from $11. Canaccord says LED pricing has fallen further than it envisioned, which will likely cause the company to miss FQ4 expectations.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:28 AM
  • KODK

    Shares of Eastman Kodak (EK) are now up 86% after its statement saying it has no intention to...

    Shares of Eastman Kodak (EK) are now up 86% after its statement saying it has no intention to file for bankruptcy is digested by investors who bailed en masse last week. The former Dow-30 stock is now all the way back up to $1.48 a share.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:17 AM
  • NFLX

    Morgan Stanley sees the recent sharp selloff in Netflix (NFLX +4.1%) making a "much more...

    Morgan Stanley sees the recent sharp selloff in Netflix (NFLX +4.1%) making a "much more compelling" valuation, plus an earnings call that could bring a positive surprise on subscriber guidance. Also, producers of cult TV comedy "Arrested Development" reportedly are in talks with Netflix about distributing some new episodes that would serve as a prelude to a movie.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:15 AM | 1 Comment
  • AA

    Deutsche's call on aluminum prices - already hitting shares of Dow-stalwart Alcoa (AA -3.5%) -...

    Deutsche's call on aluminum prices - already hitting shares of Dow-stalwart Alcoa (AA -3.5%) - is also filtering down to pressure shares of smaller aluminum producers along with downgrades. Decliners: CENX -8.6%, NOR -9.2%.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:10 AM
  • NTAP

    NetApp (NASDAQ:NTAP) rises 1.4% after Citi's Richard Gardner upgrades the storage vendor, which...

    NetApp (NASDAQ:NTAP) rises 1.4% after Citi's Richard Gardner upgrades the storage vendor, which was crushed following its August FQ1 report, to Buy. Gardner likes NetApp's valuation, and thinks FY12 estimates already take into account federal and financial weakness. He adds that his checks suggest strong calendar Q3 storage demand.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:08 AM
  • HTWR

    Shares of HeartWare (HTWR +5.6%) gain after the firm announces clinical data from its heart...

    Shares of HeartWare (HTWR +5.6%) gain after the firm announces clinical data from its heart transplant study shows a high survival rate for patients through the six-month endpoint and other positive results.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:52 AM
  • AUDC

    Israeli VoIP provider AudioCodes (AUDC -10.9%) takes a hit after cutting its Q3 guidance due to...

    Israeli VoIP provider AudioCodes (AUDC -10.9%) takes a hit after cutting its Q3 guidance due to slowing sales. The company now sees revenues for FY11 between $155M and $162M, significantly below estimates for $171.50M.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:50 AM
  • FXE

    After a failed attempt at a rally following the ISM number, the euro resumes going down,...

    After a failed attempt at a rally following the ISM number, the euro resumes going down, dropping below $1.33 for the first time since January.  The downtrend now has in its sights, the YTD low of $1.29, hit just a few days after the New Year. FXE -0.8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:49 AM | 1 Comment
  • OLED

    Universal Display (PANL -4.9%) trades lower following a critical piece on the company by The...

    Universal Display (PANL -4.9%) trades lower following a critical piece on the company by The Street Sweeper, highlighting insider selling, a history of losses, and the fact that the company's August deal with Samsung doesn't involve royalty payments. However, the last issue has been well-known by the Street since the time of the deal.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:35 AM
  • OMX

    Shares of OfficeMax (OMX -4.7%) fall as the woes continue for the retailer. Morningstar analyst...

    Shares of OfficeMax (OMX -4.7%) fall as the woes continue for the retailer. Morningstar analyst Joscelyn MacKay sees light at the end of the tunnel, saying an increased channel distribution and improved website strategy could boost sales. On the flip side, the tricky part is rival Staples (SPLS +0.5%) already has a sizable market share lead in the "sweet spot" of retail, the Northeast. Is a OMX-ODP merger in the offing?

     
     
     
     
    | 10:30 AM
  • MS

    Investors may be misreading a report on derivatives exposure that led to a recent spike in...

    Investors may be misreading a report on derivatives exposure that led to a recent spike in Morgan Stanley (NYSE:MS) CDS prices and corresponding plunge in share value, writes Matt Burnell of Wells Fargo. The headline number is $1.78T, but real exposure is just $457M, he says. Morgan's CDS have leaped to 528 bps, higher than even the troubled large Italian lenders.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:27 AM | 1 Comment
  • BHC

    Valeant Pharmaceuticals (VRX -1.4%) says buyout target Afexa Life Sciences (OTC:AFXSF) has...

    Valeant Pharmaceuticals (VRX -1.4%) says buyout target Afexa Life Sciences (OTC:AFXSF) has unanimously backed its all-cash takeover offer after the company raised its bid to quickly trump a competing offer from Paladin Labs (PLDLF.PK).

     
     
     
     
    | 10:19 AM
  • BKNG

    Morgan Stanley's Scott Devitt is upgrading Priceline (PCLN +1.9%) to Outperform and setting a...

    Morgan Stanley's Scott Devitt is upgrading Priceline (PCLN +1.9%) to Outperform and setting a $650 PT. Like Credit Suisse, Devitt is bullish on Priceline's international growth potential, and expects significant share gains for its Booking.com site in the European hotel bookings market.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:07 AM | 5 Comments

  • Shares get a boost from the better-than-expected ISM print, the S&P (at least momentarily)...

    Shares get a boost from the better-than-expected ISM print, the S&P (at least momentarily) erasing losses of about 1%. European indices cut their losses by about 1% as well, but still remain lower by 1%-2%.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:06 AM | 1 Comment
  • AAL

    American Airlines (NASDAQ:AMR) sheds 6.9%, taking on collateral damage after Citi cuts its...

    American Airlines (NASDAQ:AMR) sheds 6.9%, taking on collateral damage after Citi cuts its rating on shares of peers - clipping US Airways (LCC -1.6%) to Sell from Hold and United (UAL -2.4%) to Hold from Buy. Corporate spending on travel which until now has been relatively strong is under the microscope.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:02 AM
  • CKSW

    ClickSoftware (NASDAQ:CKSW), a provider of workforce management software, gains 5.7% after...

    ClickSoftware (NASDAQ:CKSW), a provider of workforce management software, gains 5.7% after pre-announcing Q3 revenue of $22.7M-$23.5M, above a $21M consensus, and lifting its FY11 revenue guidance to $85M-$87M, from a prior range of $81.5M-$85M. The company attributes the revised FY11 guidance to new contracts soon expected to close.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:52 AM
  • LVS

    It's another washout for shares of casino operators with revenue tied to Macau on the heels of...

    It's another washout for shares of casino operators with revenue tied to Macau on the heels of Friday's sharp selloff. Adding to the negative sentiment today is chatter China's government may step in with stricter VISA restrictions on travel from the mainland to the former Portuguese colony. Decliners: LVS -3.8%, MPEL -5.7%, WYNN -4.6%, MGM -3%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:47 AM
  • NOK

    Nomura lowers estimates for Alcatel-Lucent (ALU -7.8%) and Ericsson (ERIC -1.5%) to reflect...

    Nomura lowers estimates for Alcatel-Lucent (ALU -7.8%) and Ericsson (ERIC -1.5%) to reflect likely cuts in operator spending, but sees greater risk to ALU, "given the more challenging outlook for wireline spending and the company's high exposure to high-margin CDMA and U.S. revenues." Nomura reiterates its Buy rating on ERIC and Neutral rating on ALU.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:46 AM
  • KO

    Shares of Coca-Cola (KO -1.8%) hit a speedbump after JPMorgan downgrades its rating to Neutral...

    Shares of Coca-Cola (KO -1.8%) hit a speedbump after JPMorgan downgrades its rating to Neutral from Overweight. Analysts with the firm reduced their price target on shares to $76 from $80.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:36 AM
  • FSLR

    First Solar (NASDAQ:FSLR) drops 2.3% premarket after Credit Suisse cuts its PT to $80 and issues...

    First Solar (NASDAQ:FSLR) drops 2.3% premarket after Credit Suisse cuts its PT to $80 and issues a somewhat negative report. While calling Friday's loan guarantee deals a "net positive," and believing First Solar can survive the solar industry's current shakeout, the firm notes the final guarantee amounts were only 47% of what was promised in June.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:25 AM
  • AA

    Alcoa (NYSE:AA) drops 1.9% premarket after Deutsche cuts shares to Hold, believing falling...

    Alcoa (NYSE:AA) drops 1.9% premarket after Deutsche cuts shares to Hold, believing falling aluminum prices will badly dent earnings, and the company's high debt load poses a risk. On the flip side, the firm is upgrading Goldcorp (NYSE:GG) and Freeport-McMoRan (NYSE:FCX) to Buy (I, II), citing their reduced valuations.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:04 AM
  • KODK

    Premarket gainers: EK +40%. YHOO +4%.Losers: SGMO -26%. ACI -11%. ALU -7%. NPEL -7%. TS -4%. CS...

    Premarket gainers: EK +40%. YHOO +4%.
    Losers: SGMO -26%. ACI -11%. ALU -7%. NPEL -7%. TS -4%. CS -4%. LVS -4%. WYNN -4%. LCC -3%. UBS -3%. TLK -3%.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:00 AM

  • Gold (+2.5%) and silver (+3.1%) have regained their footing even as global stocks continue to...

    Gold (+2.5%) and silver (+3.1%) have regained their footing even as global stocks continue to slide, but copper continues lower, falling below $3/lb. last night for the 1st time since mid-2010. The industrial metal is currently -2.7% at $3.07.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:56 AM
  • MDCO

    Shares of Medicines (NASDAQ:MDCO) shoot up 10.4% premarket after the firm settles patent...

    Shares of Medicines (NASDAQ:MDCO) shoot up 10.4% premarket after the firm settles patent litigation with Teva Parenteral Medicines in relation to generic versions of Angiomax. As part of the agreement, Teva admits two patents asserted in the lawsuit filed by MDCO are valid and enforceable.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:44 AM
  • EBS

    Emergent BioSolutions (NYSE:EBS) rises 3.7% premarket after announcing it's won a 5-year, $1.25B...

    Emergent BioSolutions (NYSE:EBS) rises 3.7% premarket after announcing it's won a 5-year, $1.25B deal to supply its BioThrax anthrax vaccine to the U.S. government. The firm adds BioThrax is the only vaccine licensed by the FDA to prevent anthrax infection.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:22 AM
  • SGMO

    Sangamo BioSciences (NASDAQ:SGMO) drops 36.8% premarket after announcing it didn't meet the...

    Sangamo BioSciences (NASDAQ:SGMO) drops 36.8% premarket after announcing it didn't meet the clinical endpoints it hoped to achieve in a Phase 2b trial of its SB-509 drug for treating diabetic neuropathy. As a result, Sangamo plans to discontinue development of SB-509.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:53 AM

    Macau casino stocks plunge in Hong Kong - outpacing a 4.4% decline in the Hang Seng - on...

    Macau casino stocks plunge in Hong Kong - outpacing a 4.4% decline in the Hang Seng - on increasing fears tighter credit will cut off the funds of wealthy gamblers. Close to two-thirds of Macau's gaming revenue is kicked up from "junkets" from the mainland. The largest casino, SJM Holdings, plummets 25%.
